channel.title: This Life #YOULIVE With Dr Drew
channel.itunes:summary: Dr. Drew and Bob Forrest from MTV's Celebrity Rehab join forces to address all things about THIS LIFE regarding sobriety and normy culture with celebrity guests. PLUS, A NEW BONUS! Recent episodes of THIS LIFE #YOULIVE, an interactive caller Facebook Live/ You Tube spin off show with popular co-host Mike Catherwood of Loveline and Talk Radio KABC 790. This Life With Dr. Drew #YOULIVE is taking calls. Go to Facebook/Drdrew and YouTube/Drdrew or Drdrew.com for details.

channel.description: Dr. Drew and Rehab Bob Forrest from MTV's Celebrity Rehab talk about "This Life" with featured guests. Also introducing the exciting and new video channel offshoot, "This Life #YOULIVE" podcast available at youtube/Drdrew and Facebook/Drdrew featuring the previous KROQ Loveline co-host Mike Catherwood who is the current partner on KABC AM 790 Midday Live podcast. item.title: #YOULIVE 129 - Claudia Christian and Dr John Mendelson
item.description:
Actress Claudia Christian and Dr. John Mendelson discuss The Sinclair Method for treatment of alcohol abuse disorder on @thislifepodcast #YOULIVE. The program, which saved her life, utilizes a prescription medication, a phone app and medical guidance to help patients reduce or quit alcohol use. Bob and Drew were hesitant at first, but found the interview to be informative. Share if you care, tell a friend, save a life. Find all the podcasts on drdrew.com. Find @ClaudiaLives on twitter.

Sponsored by Bergamet. go to drdrew.com for discounts on the banner.

item.title: #YOULIVE 127 - PJ Schrantz & Dopey Guys
item.description: PJ Schrantz of Vodcast "Serving Those Who Serve" is a former New York City firefighter and 9/11 first responder whom has dedicated his life to helping others in need.  Since losing his son Dustin at age seven to leukemia, he has spearheaded many efforts to help veterans, firefighters and police officers.  Bob and Drew hear his story of sobriety after his traumatic past and hitting bottom. Then, after the break, on a lighter note, Chris & Dave from 'The Dopey Podcast' make an appearance and get a quick interview with Mike Catherwood of The Swole Patrol Podcast.  Support us and get discounts on Bergamet and Hydralyte at Drdrew.com and links to all the shows. #YOULIVE

item.description:
This week's guest is 2018 Republican Congressional candidate Carla Spalding, who is seeking to represent the state of Florida.  She is a psychiatric nurse, single mom and Navy veteran who is now focused on fixing the opioids crisis in her home state. www.spaldingforcongress.com  

This episode is sponsored by Bergamet and Hydralyte.

item.title: #YOULIVE 123 - Dr. Lisa Strohman And Gene Rugala
item.description:
Dr. Drew hosts Dr. Lisa Strohman, attorney and psychologist @drlisastrohman and retired FBI profiler Gene Rugala who served as the lead profiler in the Columbine tragedy in a discussion about school violence in America.  The group discusses the warning signs of school violence, the role of mental health and what needs to happen to stop future violence.

item.title: #YOULIVE 104: Brian Claypool VS. PTSD
item.description:
Brian Claypool survives Las Vegas Massacre and opens up on a Sunday afternoon to continue a dark discussion with Dr. Erin Foster and trauma specialist/ FBI agent Bobby Chacon. He describes his traumatic experience on Oct 1 during the Route 91 concert sharing his deepest emotions and anger in the aftermath. Then Brian asks our experts how to deal with the PTSD, and how we can avoid this from ever happening in the future. 

This episode is sponsored by Alliant CSP University and Hydralyte.
item.content:encoded:
Brian Claypool survives Las Vegas Massacre and opens up on a Sunday afternoon to continue a dark discussion with Dr. Erin Foster and trauma specialist/ FBI agent Bobby Chacon. He describes his traumatic experience on Oct 1 during the Route 91 concert sharing his deepest emotions and anger in the aftermath. Then Brian asks our experts how to deal with the PTSD, and how we can avoid this from ever happening in the future. 

This episode is sponsored by Alliant CSP University and Hydralyte.

item.title: This Life 86: Tom Arnold
item.description:
We have so much appreciation for our guests who are honest about their lives. In light of what was released in Carrie Fischer's autopsy report today, we are reminded of the fact that addiction is a fatal disease. Tom Arnold looks into his past trauma experiences with psychologist Dr. Cheryl Arutt, Drew and Bob. Tom checked himself into rehab recently after his battle with a benzodiazepine addiction. He also spills some interesting facts about a President of the United States, or two.

Outro Music "Masquerade" by Fabrizio And The Fever from their "Head Theatre EP" available on iTunes.

This Episode is sponsored by Alliant University and Refillwise

item.title: This Life 77: She Recovers Dawn Nickel
item.description:
She Recovers founder, Dawn Nickel, joins Dr. Drew and Bob to discuss her organization's goal to "embrace all types of recovery."  She Recovers welcomes anyone who is recovering from anything, whether it's addiction, grief or cancer, to find "individualized paths and patchworks for recovery." Dawn has a PhD in health care policy and has been in recovery herself for over twenty-seven years.  SheRecovers.com 

This episode is sponsored by Alliant University and Hydralyte.

Outro "Well Behaved Women" by KellyeAnn Keough, courtesy ofwww.kellyeannKeough.com

item.title: This Life 73: Sherry Gaba
item.description:
What happens when four Celebrity Rehab experts get together to discuss their own stories of recovery?  Find out on this week's episode of This Life.  Psychotherapist, life coach and certified recovery expert/editor of Recoverytodaymagazine.com, Sherry Gaba, and Shelly The Shark Sprague share personal journeys while Bob and Dr. Drew chime in with their own personal experiences of co-dependency and addiction. Sherry has worked at some of the top rehabilitation centers.  Presently she works at Soba Recovery Center.

Outro Music: Indigo by Alke, courtesy of Alkemusic.com

This Episode is sponsored by Bergamet Sport, Hydralyte and RefillWise.

item.title: This Life 68: Deanna And Steven Adler
item.description:
Steven Adler's mother Deanna, author of Sweet Child of Mine, How I Lost My Son To Guns N' Roses speaks openly about her personal experience with her son who is a well know heroin addict. This alumni Celebrity Rehab star has 5 years sobriety, and also joins Bob and Dr. Drew to talk about his successful journey to sobriety after his experience on the MTV show that literally gave him his life back. Dr Bruce Heischober, Co-Writer Lawrence J Spagnola, and Jamie Adler chime in. 

Outro Music "Welcome To The Jungle" by Bob Forrest, from his album "Modern Folk And Blues: Wednesdays" available on iTunes.

item.title: This Life 67: Battlefield Addiction
item.description:
Art Dahlen, Amy Brooks and Angie Keaty of battlefieldaddiction.com join Dr. Drew and Bob Forrest to discuss their techniques for treating addiction.  Battlefield Addiction is a highly effective family recovery program, based out of Des Moines, Washington. Their mission statement: "Reconnecting the Family, the Addict and the Community.  Empowering families through our straight forward approach, providing expert guidance and a lifetime network of support services."

Sponsored by Bergamet and the National Assessment Foundation.

Outro music: "Memphis" by KellyeAnn Keough. Courtesy of www.kellyeannkeough.com
